name: Post-Traumatic Nasal Septal Perforation
chief_complaint: My nose keeps whistling when I breathe and it's crusty inside
treatment: possible surgical repair with mucosal flap
prognosis: Good with proper management, though complete closure may require surgical intervention
description: A full-thickness defect in the nasal septum resulting from previous nasal trauma (6 months prior), causing disruption of normal nasal airflow and mucosal function. The perforation leads to turbulent airflow, crust formation, and potential epistaxis.
